perturbation.original_text: Company, either directly or through its authorized service provider, shall provide customer service (the "Customer Service") relating to Client Website consisting of replying to customer questions or complaints regarding website hosting services during the normal business hours set forth. Company is not obligated to provide any Customer Service except as specified in this Section. Company at its sole discretion may at any time alter or cease providing the Customer Service which it has agreed to provide to Client relating to Client Website pursuant to this Agreement without any liability to Company.
perturbation.changed_text: Company may provide customer service (the "Customer Service") relating to Client Website consisting of replying to customer questions or complaints regarding website hosting services. Company at its sole discretion may at any time alter or cease providing the Customer Service which it may provide to Client relating to Client Website pursuant to this Agreement without any liability to Company.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the obligation for the company to provide customer service, the contract is violating the consumer's right to receive assistance for services they are paying for. This is especially problematic as the nature of "website hosting services" requires technical assistance and is often considered a requirement of legally compliant service.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Consumer Protection Laws related to service contracts

perturbation.original_text: Client agrees that any unsolicited positive feedback Client provides to Company may be used in any Company marketing and/or advertising materials (i.e., customer testimonials). Client further agrees that Company may use and display the graphics and other web design elements of Client's website as examples of Company website design and development work.
perturbation.changed_text: Client agrees that any feedback Client provides to Company may be used in any Company marketing and/or advertising materials. Client further agrees that Company may use and display the graphics and other web design elements of Client's website as examples of Company website design and development work.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the word "unsolicited", the contract now allows the company to use any and all feedback, without clarifying the need of consent or notification of its use. This is a violation of privacy laws, as now the company can directly ask for reviews, and reuse the review, without any additional consent required. This is in violation of consumer protection laws related to privacy and data usage.
perturbation.contradicted_law: GDPR, CCPA and other privacy laws

perturbation.original_text: Company will use its best efforts to deliver the Client Website in the time frame specified in the Scope of Work. Terms of the project: 12 weeks from February 8, 2018 to May 3, 2018. Client acknowledges and agrees that any due dates set forth in the Scope of Work are subject to delay if Company does not receive the required materials or documentation in a timely manner or in the required format or if approvals are delayed by Client or if the Scope of Work is changed by Client.
perturbation.changed_text: Company will endeavor to deliver the Client Website. Client acknowledges and agrees that any due dates set forth in the Scope of Work are subject to delay if approvals are delayed by Client or if the Scope of Work is changed by Client.
perturbation.explanation: By weakening 'Company will use its best efforts' to 'Company will endeavor to deliver', removing the specific timeline, and removing the condition relating to 'Company does not receive the required materials or documentation in a timely manner or in the required format' this change allows for infinite delays, which violates implied contract law. This violates consumer's rights to timely performance and could be seen as an unfair or unconscionable contract.
